Articles.Content:
Welcome, contestants of the J. Kerman prize! Jebediah himself challenges you to build a suborbital spacecraft, launch it to at least 69,078 m, and then manually return it safely to the ground. Reasonable mods allowed*

Can be carried up on a "mothership" to altitude, where it launches off. The mothership must parachute back, and use only atmospheric engines.

*Example-DRobotics, DAerospace, NovaPunch
Impossible, plus, there is already a thread similar to this.

Ignoring the "mothership", which seems optional.

Is this not just the K-Prize but without the orbit?

People have also been building and testing craft for other planets by landing on Kerbin and ascending again. It's all very possible.
I am quite sure that several of my failed K-Prize craft are quite capable of this challenge, and none of them require a "mothership", or utilise the fuel bug.
Let's see... does a parachute count as reusable?
I got to 5,477,000+ with my MOLD X(Roman 10, not X) and parachuted down safely into the water

He said 'can' be carried up on a mothership, meaning it's not required, and he says nothing about the suborbital craft having air breathing engines, so just build a rocket capable of going straight up to space, and back down on a parachute...I don't think this challenge was very well thought through...

Edited September 8, 2012 by Boex
In other words, just get a rocket out of the atmosphere, decouple the pod and let it parachute down?
It says you should manually get back, so maybe he meant a powered landing on Kerbin (of course without MechJeb)? He only said that the mothership would have to be parachuted.
There doesn't seem to be anything that says this has to be reusable.. So I can just launch a normal rocket to 69000m, and then decouple the pod and parachute down.

No, I think you need to reuse EVERYTHING, i.e. no ditching the spent rocket. Just add another parachute, and you should be fine, or add more fuel and do a last-minute engine fire to kill some velocity.
